intro: Brassica nigra var. laevigata, commonly known as the smooth black mustard, is a variety of the black mustard plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a biennial or annual plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring erect, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a slightly rough texture. Its flowers are small, yellow, and arranged in racemes, blooming from late spring to early summer. The plant produces long, slender pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice.
